blocks.description: This expression represents the derivative of $y$ with respect to $x$. Setting it to zero allows us to find critical points.
This equation gives the relationship between $y$ and $x$ derived from implicit differentiation.
This differentiation demonstrates how to apply the chain rule and quotient rule in calculus.

blocks.description: This equation calculates the rate of change of $m$ with respect to $x$ based on derived functions.

blocks.text: Proof of the construction for the slope curve given on p. 14.
Let us deal first with the particular principle in which the equation of the primitive curve is given.
Referring to Fig. 4, the equation of the curve OAB is $y = 2x^3$.
Hence the difference between the ordinates of the curves OAB and CG, the latter being regarded as the base curve—

blocks.description: This equation shows the relationship between the ordinates of two curves and signifies the height difference.
